title: Easy Ways to Open Task Scheduler in Windows 10 & 11: Run, CMD, and More

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+R on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + R on your keyboard. This opens the Run dialog.

steps.title: Hit ↵ Enter or click OK.
steps.content: Hit ↵ Enter or click OK . This opens Task Scheduler in a new window.

steps.title: Type task scheduler into the Windows search bar.
steps.content: Type task scheduler into the Windows search bar. If you don't see the search bar, press the Windows key on your keyboard to activate it, or press Windows key + S .

steps.title: Type task scheduler.
steps.content: Type task scheduler . Windows will now search for the application.

steps.title: Click Task Scheduler to open Task Scheduler.
steps.content: Click Task Scheduler to open Task Scheduler.

steps.title: Launch it via the Windows search.
steps.content: Launch it via the Windows search.

steps.title: Open Command Prompt
steps.content: Open Command Prompt . To launch the Command Prompt , type cmd into the Windows search bar and press Enter .

steps.title: Type control schedtasks and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type control schedtasks and press ↵ Enter . This opens Task Scheduler in a separate window. Alternatively, you can type taskschd.msc and press Enter . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Start menu.
steps.content: Click the Start menu. Alternatively, you can press the Windows key on your keyboard to open it.

steps.title: Click All Apps on the menu.
steps.content: Click All Apps on the menu.

steps.title: Click Windows Administrative Tools.
steps.content: Click Windows Administrative Tools . This displays programs you can use to take care of administrative tasks, including Task Scheduler.

steps.title: Click Task Scheduler to open it.
steps.content: Click Task Scheduler to open it. It'll be near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+R on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + R on your keyboard . This opens the Run dialog.

steps.title: Type control admintools and hit ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type control admintools and hit ↵ Enter . This opens the administrative tools area of Control Panel.

steps.title: Click Task Scheduler to open it.
steps.content: Click Task Scheduler to open it.
